definition:
Let $\Gamma$ be a family of plane curves. The [*isocline*]{} of $\Gamma$
is the locus of the points, in which all members of $\Gamma$ have an
equal slope.

If the family $\Gamma$ has the differential equation
$$F(x,\,y,\,\frac{dy}{dx}) = 0,$$ then the equation of any isocline of
$\Gamma$ has the form $$F(x,\,y,\,K) = 0$$ where $K$ is .\
For example, the family $$y = e^{Cx}$$ of curves satisfies the
differential equation $\frac{dy}{dx} = Ce^{Cx}$ or $\frac{dy}{dx} = Cy$,
whence the isoclines are $Cy =K$, i.e. they are horizontal lines.\
